Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Mocha \Mo"cha\, n. 1. A seaport town of Yemen, on the Red Sea, also spelled {Mukha}. [1913 Webster]
2. A variety of coffee originally brought from Mocha. [1913 Webster]
3. An Abyssinian weight, equivalent to a Troy grain. [1913 Webster]
4. A flavoring made from an infusion of coffee or of a combination of coffee with chocolate or cocoa. [PJC]
5. A color of a deep chocolate brown. [PJC]
{Mocha stone} (Min.), moss agate. [1913 Webster]
mocha n 1: soft suede glove leather from goatskin 2: flavoring made from mixed coffee and chocolate 3: superior dark coffee made from beans from Arabia
